info.title: Cashfree Payment Gateway APIs
info.description: Cashfree's Payment Gateway APIs provide developers with a streamlined pathway to integrate advanced payment processing capabilities into their applications, platforms and websites.

externalDocs.description: This url will have the information of all the APIs.

VendorRecon200Response.title: VendorRecon200Response
VendorRecon200Response.description: Fetch Vendor Recon details success response.

pagination.description: The merchant can set pagination limits based on their use case. The minimum limit is 10. Pagination will fetch a set of records, and the next set of records can be generated using the cursor provided in response to the first request for all reconciliation APIs.

limit.description: Set the minimum or maximum limit for the number of filtered data. Minimum value: 10, Maximum value: 100.

cursor.description: Specifies from where the next set of records should be fetched.

filters.description: Specify the filters for the desired use case.

settlement_id.description: Specify the Settlement ID for which you want to fetch the order details. Relevant for "View Split Order Details Using Settlement ID".

merchant_vendor_id.description: Specify the Vendor ID for which you want to fetch the recon details. Relevant for "Vendor Recon Using Vendor ID & Time Interval".

start_date.description: Start date for fetching reconciliation details. Relevant for "Vendor Recon for a Time Period" and "Vendor Recon Using Vendor ID & Time Interval".

end_date.description: End date for fetching reconciliation details. Relevant for "Vendor Recon for a Time Period" and "Vendor Recon Using Vendor ID & Time Interval".

channel.description: The channel for card payments can be "link" or "post". Post is used for seamless OTP payments where merchant captures OTP on their own page.

card_number.description: Customer card number for plain card transactions. Token pan number for tokenized card transactions.

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_expiry_mm.description: Card expiry month for plain card transactions. Token expiry month for tokenized card transactions.

card_expiry_yy.description: Card expiry year for plain card transactions. Token expiry year for tokenized card transactions.

instrument_id.description: instrument id of saved card. Required only to make payment using saved instrument.

cryptogram.description: cryptogram received from card network. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

token_requestor_id.description: TRID issued by card networks. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

token_reference_id.description: Token Reference Id provided by Diners for Guest Checkout Token.  Required only for Diners cards.

card_display.description: last 4 digits of original card number. Required only for tokenized card transactions.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API.

card_bank_name.description: One of ["Kotak", "ICICI", "RBL", "BOB", "Standard Chartered"]. Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI

country_code.description: Country Code. Should be in ISO 2 format (ie. US for United States)

state_code.description: State Code. Should be in ISO 2 format (ie. FL for Florida)

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

CardArray.title: card array
CardArray.description: short code for credit card, debit card, prepaid card

channel.description: The channel for card payments will always be "link"

card_holder_name.description: Customer name mentioned on the card.

card_alias.description: Card alias as returned by Cashfree Vault API

card_bank_name.description: Card bank name, required for EMI payments. This is the bank user has selected for EMI. One of ["hdfc, "kotak", "icici", "rbl", "bob", "standard chartered", "axis", "au", "yes", "sbi", "fed", "hsbc", "citi", "amex"]

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure selected by the user

CardlessEMI.description: Request body for cardless emi payment method

channel.description: The channel for cardless EMI is always `link`

phone.description: Customers phone number for this payment instrument. If the customer is not eligible you will receive a 400 error with type as 'invalid_request_error' and code as 'invalid_request_error'

emi_tenure.description: EMI tenure for the selected provider. This is mandatory when provider is one of [`hdfc`, `icici`, `cashe`, `idfc`, `kotak`]

order_id.description: OrderId of the order. Either of `order_id` or `amount` is mandatory.

amount.description: Amount of the order. OrderId of the order. Either of `order_id` or `amount` is mandatory.

CreateCustomerRequest.title: CreateCustomerRequest
CreateCustomerRequest.description: Request body to create a customer at cashfree

entity.description: Entity type should be PAYMENTS or SUBS_PAYMENTS only.

entity_id.description: If the entity type is PAYMENTS, the entity_id will be the transactionId. If the entity type is SUBS_PAYMENTS, the entity_id will be the merchantTxnId

link_id.description: Unique Identifier (provided by merchant) for the Link. Alphanumeric and only - and _ allowed (50 character limit). Use this for other link-related APIs.

link_amount.description: Amount to be collected using this link. Provide upto two decimals for paise.

link_currency.description: Currency for the payment link. Default is INR. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

link_purpose.description: A brief description for which payment must be collected. This is shown to the customer.

link_partial_payments.description: If "true", customer can make partial payments for the link.

link_minimum_partial_amount.description: Minimum amount in first installment that needs to be paid by the customer if partial payments are enabled. This should be less than the link_amount.

link_expiry_time.description: Time after which the link expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. You can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Default is 30 days.

link_auto_reminders.description: If "true", reminders will be sent to customers for collecting payments.

order_splits.description: If you have Easy split enabled in your Cashfree account then you can use this option to split the order amount.

CreateOrderRequest.title: CreateOrderRequest
CreateOrderRequest.description: Request body to create an order at cashfree

order_id.description: Order identifier present in your system. Alphanumeric, '_' and '-' only

order_amount.description: Bill amount for the order. Provide upto two decimals. 10.15 means Rs 10 and 15 paisa

order_currency.description: Currency for the order. INR if left empty. Contact care@cashfree.com to enable new currencies.

order_expiry_time.description: Time after which the order expires. Customers will not be able to make the payment beyond the time specified here. We store timestamps in IST, but you can provide them in a valid ISO 8601 time format. Example 2021-07-02T10:20:12+05:30 for IST, 2021-07-02T10:20:12Z for UTC

order_splits.description: If you have Easy split enabled in your Cashfree account then you can use this option to split the order amount.

limit.description: Number of settlements you want to fetch in the next iteration. Maximum limit is 1000, default value is 10.

To fetch the next set of settlements, pass the cursor received in the response to the next API call.

 Limit would be number of settlements that you want to receive.

order_status.description:
Possible values are 
- `ACTIVE`: Order does not have a sucessful transaction yet
- `PAID`: Order is PAID with one successful transaction
- `EXPIRED`: Order was not PAID and not it has expired. No transaction can be initiated for an EXPIRED order.
`TERMINATED`: Order terminated
`TERMINATION_REQUESTED`: Order termination requested

OrderMeta.description: Optional meta details to control how the customer pays and how payment journey completes

return_url.description: The URL to which user will be redirected to after the payment on bank OTP page. Maximum length: 250. We suggest to keep context of order_id in your return_url so that you can identify the order when customer lands on your page. Example of return_url format could be https://www.cashfree.com/devstudio/thankyou

notify_url.description: Notification URL for server-server communication. Useful when user's connection drops while re-directing. NotifyUrl should be an https URL. Maximum length: 250.

payment_methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Pass comma-separated values among following options - "cc", "dc", "ccc", "ppc","nb","upi","paypal","app","paylater","cardlessemi","dcemi","ccemi","banktransfer". Leave it blank to show all available payment methods

payment_methods_filters.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. Along with multiple filters for cards can be added to this key. And this filtering will be honoured during transaction creation.

methods.description: Allowed payment modes for this order. credit_card, debit_card, netbanking, paylater, etc are the values that can be passed to this parameter.

action.description: It accepts value of "ALLOW" and allows only those modes present in it's neighbouring parameter "values"

values.description: The accepted entries for this paramter are "debit_card, credit_card, prepaid_card, upi, wallet, netbanking, banktransfer, paylater, paypal, debit_card_emi, credit_card_emi, upi_credit_card, upi_ppi, cardless_emi, account_based_payment, corporate_credit_card, sbc_debit_card, sbc_emandate, sbc_upi, sbc_credit_card"

filters.description: This object takes details of all the filtering that has to be done for this order. Filters on card bins, card schemes, card issuing bank and card suffixes

card_bins.description: Allowed card bins for the order

action.description: It accepts value of "ALLOW" and allows only those bins present in it's neighbouring parameter "values"

values.description: List of card bins to be allowed for the order

card_schemes.description: Allowed card schemes for the order

action.description: It accepts value of "ALLOW" and allows only those schemes present in it's neighbouring parameter "values"

values.description: List of card schemes to be allowed for the order

card_suffix.description: Allowed card suffixes for the order

action.description: It accepts value of "ALLOW" and allows only those suffixes present in it's neighbouring parameter "values"

values.description: List of card suffixes to be allowed for the order

card_issuing_bank.description: Allowed card issuing bank for the order

action.description: It accepts value of "ALLOW" and allows only those issuing bank present in it's neighbouring parameter "values"

values.description: List of card issuing bank to be allowed for the order

OrderTags.description: Custom Tags in thr form of {"key":"value"} which can be passed for an order. A maximum of 10 tags can be added

enabled.description: Whether the feature has been enabled for this order

action.description: The Action key in the conditions array specifies whether a condition is allowed or denied for the specified rule or feature

ProductDetails.description: Specify the required configurations for this feature

enabled.description: Option to enable or disable the feature

conditions.description: The conditions array allows to configure rules by adding condition objects with specific parameters for feature configurations.

action.description: The Action key in the conditions array specifies whether a condition should "ALLOW" or "DENY" the specified rule or feature

key.description: Specify what you're trying to configure, such as "features"

values.description: Define the values you need to set within the conditions in this array, such as "checkoutCollectAddress", "checkoutAuthenticate"

PayOrderEntity.description: Order Pay response once you create a transaction for that order

channel.description: One of ["link", "collect", "qrcode"]. In an older version we used to support different channels like 'gpay', 'phonepe' etc. However, we now support only the following channels - link, collect and qrcode. To process payments using gpay, you will have to provide channel as 'link' and provider as 'gpay'

CreateSubscriptionRequest.description: Request body to create a new subscription.

subscription_id.description: A unique ID for the subscription. It can include alphanumeric characters, underscore, dot, hyphen, and space. Maximum characters allowed is 250.

plan_id.description: The unique identifier used to create plan. You only need to pass this field if you had already created plan. Otherwise use the other fields here to define the plan.

plan_name.description: Specify plan name for easy reference.

plan_type.description: Possible values ON_DEMAND or PERIODIC. PERIODIC - Payments are triggered automatically at fixed intervals defined by the merchant. ON_DEMAND - Merchant needs to trigger/charge the customer explicitly with the required amount.

plan_amount.description: The amount to be charged for PERIODIC plan. This is a conditional parameter, only required for PERIODIC plans.

plan_max_amount.description: This is the maximum amount that can be charged on a subscription.

plan_max_cycles.description: Maximum number of debits set for the plan. The subscription will automatically change to COMPLETED status once this limit is reached.

plan_intervals.description: Number of intervals of intervalType between every subscription payment. For example, to charge a customer bi-weekly use intervalType as â€œweekâ€ and intervals as 2. Required for PERIODIC plan. The default value is 1.

plan_interval_type.description: The type of interval for a PERIODIC plan like DAY, WEEK, MONTH, or YEAR. This is a conditional parameter only applicable for PERIODIC plans.

authorization_amount.description: Authorization amount for the auth payment.

authorization_amount_refund.description: Indicates whether the authorization amount should be refunded to the customer automatically. Merchants can use this field to specify if the authorized funds should be returned to the customer after authorization of the subscription.

payment_methods.description: Payment methods for the subscription. enach, pnach, upi, card are possible values.

return_url.description: The url to redirect after checkout.

notification_channel.description: Notification channel for the subscription. SMS, EMAIL are possible values.

subscription_first_charge_time.description: Time at which the first charge will be made for the subscription after authorization. Applicable only for PERIODIC plans.

ManageSubscriptionPaymentRequest.title: ManageSubscriptionPaymentRequest
ManageSubscriptionPaymentRequest.description: Request body to manage a subscription payment.

subscription_id.description: The unique ID which was used to create subscription.

payment_id.description: The unique ID which was used to create payment.

action.description: Action to be performed on the payment. Possible values - CANCEL, RETRY.

action_details.description: Details of the action to be performed. Needed for retry action.

next_scheduled_time.description: Next scheduled time for the retry of the FAILED payment. Required for retry action.

CreateSubscriptionPaymentRequest.title: CreateSubscriptionPaymentRequest
CreateSubscriptionPaymentRequest.description: The request to be passed for the create subscription payment API.

subscription_id.description: A unique ID passed by merchant for identifying the subscription.

subscription_session_id.description: Session ID for the subscription. Required only for Auth.

payment_id.description: A unique ID passed by merchant for identifying the subscription payment.

payment_amount.description: The charge amount of the payment. Required in case of charge.

payment_schedule_date.description: The date on which the payment is scheduled to be processed. Required for UPI and CARD payment modes.

payment_type.description: Payment type. Can be AUTH or CHARGE.

payment_method.description: Payment method. Can be one of ["upi", "enach", "pnach", "card"]

channel.description: Channel. can be link, qrcode, or collect

auth_mode.description: Authentication mode. can be debit_card, aadhaar, or net_banking

SubscriptionEligibilityRequest.description: Request body to fetch subscription eligibile payment method details.

queries.description: Necessary parameters to fetch eligible payment methods.

subscription_id.description: A unique ID passed by merchant for identifying the subscription

filters.description: Filters to refine eligible payment method selection.

payment_methods.description: Possbile values in array - enach, pnach, upi, card.

account_auth_modes.description: List of account authentication modes supported by the bank. (e.g. DEBIT_CARD, NET_BANKING, AADHAAR)

eligibility.description: Indicates whether the payment method is eligible.

entity_value.description: Payment method (e.g., enach, pnach, upi, card).

account_types.description: List of account types associated with the payment method. (e.g. SAVINGS or CURRENT)

frequent_bank_details.description: List of the most frequently used banks.

all_bank_details.description: Details about all banks associated with the payment method.

application.description: Application or service related to the VPA handle.

allowed_card_types.description: List of allowed card types. (e.g. DEBIT_CARD, CREDIT_CARD)

items.description: List of allowed card types associated with the payment method.

type.description: List of eligibile payment methods for the subscription.

card_number.description: The card number, containing 15 to 19 numeric digits without spaces or special characters.

card_cvv.description: The Card Verification Value (CVV), a 3-digit code for most cards (Visa, Mastercard) and a 4-digit code for American Express, used for transaction authentication.

card_expiry_mm.description: The two-digit expiry month (01-12), indicating when the card will expire.

card_expiry_yy.description: The two-digit expiry year, representing the last two digits of the cardâ€™s expiration year.

card_type.description: Specifies the type of card, with the only accepted value being `PLAIN_CARD`.

x-api-version.description: This header has the version of the API. The current version is `2022-09-01`.

x-idempotency-key.description: An idempotency key is a unique identifier you include with your API call. If the request fails or times out, you can safely retry it using the same key to avoid duplicate actions.

x-idempotency-replayed.description:
In conjunction with `x-idempotency-key` this means
- `true` if the response was replayed
- `false` if the response has not been replayed

x-ratelimit-limit.description: Ratelimit set for your account for this API per minute

x-ratelimit-remaining.description: Rate limit remaning for your account for this API in the next minute. Uses sliding window

x-ratelimit-retry.description:
Contains number of seconds to wait if rate limit is breached
- Is 0 if withing the limit
- Is between 1 and 59 if breached

x-ratelimit-type.description:
either ip or app_id
- `ip` if making a call from the browser. True for api where you don't need `x-client-id` and `x-client-secret`
- `app_id` for authenticated api calls i.e using `x-client-id` and `x-client-secret`

x-request-id.description: Request id for your api call. Is blank or null if no `x-request-id` is sent during the request

post.description:
### Order
An order is an entity which has a amount and currency associated with it. It is something for which you want to collect payment for.
Use this API to create orders with Cashfree from your backend to get a `payment_sessions_id`. 
You can use the `payment_sessions_id` to create a transaction for the order.

get.description:
Use this API to fetch the order that was created at Cashfree's using the `order_id`. 
## When to use this API
- To check the status of your order
- Once the order is PAID
- Once your customer returns to `return_url`

patch.description: Use this API to terminate the order that was created at Cashfree's using the `order_id`.

get.description:
Use this API to fetch the order related data like address,cart,offers,customer details etc using the Cashfree's `order_id`.
## When to use this API
- To get the extended data associated with order.
- Once the order is PAID
- Once your customer returns to `return_url`
